citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of a new mesophilic, secondary alcohol utilizing methanogen, Methanobacterium palustre spec. nov., from a peat bog.

p.s: Description of Methanobacterium palustre sp. nov.
Methanobacterium palustre (pa.lu.stre. M.L. neutr. adj. paluster, palustris palustre meaning muddy, living in a muddy environment)
Rod-shaped cells, 0.5 x 2.5-5 μm in size, occasionally form filaments of up to 65 μm.
Colonies on agar medium are yellowish, round, convex with a smooth surface, 2- 3 mm in diameter.
Utilizes H2/CO2, formate, 2-propanol/CO2 and 2-butanol/CO2 for growth and/or methane production.
The G + C content of the DNA is 34 mol% (Tm).
DNA-DNA-homology with M. formicicum 21%, with M. bryantii M.o.H. 20%.
The habitat is a marshy soil in the Sippenauer Moor close to Kelheim/Bavaria.
The type strain is strain F (DSM 3108).
